title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT(ECD)

description.narrative: Output 2.1 By 2025, boys and girls aged 3-5 years, particularly the rural, urban poor and refugees, access quality pre-primary education through formal and non-formal learning centres, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2025, girls and boys aged 3-19 progressively achieve age-appropriate learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1 By 2025, boys and girls aged 3-5 years, particularly the rural, urban poor and refugees, access quality pre-primaryeducation through formal and non-formal learning centres

description.narrative: Despite prolonged ;closure of pre-primary ;classes ;and ECD centers, some progress has been made to support young children, parents, and caregivers, reaching 15,124 children with community and home-based programmes, 1,201 ECD caregivers with training, and ensuring that 53% of targeted ECD centres were licensed. In addition, the provision of integrated ECD services continued to the extent that was possible. The National Early Childhood Care and Education Policy was approved while progress was made to institutionalize the coordination of ECD in the country.;;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:08/01/2022

baseline.value: Central and local government IECD coordination mechanisms meet none of the 4 criteria of full functionality

actual.value: 2021:Only 20 of the 29 (69%) districts meet 2 of the 4 criteria of full functionality
